definitions.definition: ( countable ) A play , dance , or other entertainment .
examples: There were a thousand people at the show .

definitions.definition: ( countable ) A broadcast program , especially a light entertainment program.
examples: I spotted my neighbour on the morning TV show .

definitions.definition: ( Australia , New Zealand , countable ) An agricultural exhibition .
examples: I'm taking the kids to the show on Tuesday.
Let's get on with the show .
Let's get this show on the road.
They went on an international road show to sell the shares to investors.
It was Apple's usual dog and pony show .

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) Mere display or pomp with no substance.  (Usually seen in the phrases "all show" and "for show".)
examples: The dog sounds ferocious but it's all show .

definitions.definition: Outward appearance; wileful or deceptive appearance.

examples: He played AA ball for years, but never made it to the show .

definitions.definition: ( mining , obsolete ) A pale blue flame at the top of a candle flame, indicating the presence of firedamp .
( medicine ) A discharge , from the vagina , of mucus streaked with blood , occurring a short time before labor .
( military , slang ) A battle ; local conflict. [from 1892]

definitions.definition: Synonym of shive ( “ wood fragment of the husk of flax or hemp ” ) .

main_definition: Synonym of shive ( “ wood fragment of the husk of flax or hemp ” ) .
